text.text_translated: If we are aware of possible differences in expectations and behaviour, it can help us avoid communication problems. However, it is very important to remember that cultural **stereotypes** can be harmful to building good business relationships. Stereotypes are simple but often untrue ideas about what a group of people is like. National cultures can influence the way we behave and think. However, we are also mainly influenced by other things. These include the region we come from, the communities we are part of, our age and gender, our company's culture, and our own personal experiences. Therefore, we should keep this knowledge of possible differences in mind. We should not use it to put every person from an entire nation into a simple group.
